trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> objects associated with a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> or server control acting as a provider in a connection.
This class cannot be inherited.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> or server control acting as a provider in a Web Parts connection can have multiple provider connection points.

One <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> object in a provider acts as the connection point for any given connection, serving as the primary interface instance to pass to one or more consumers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class contains the collection of all the connection points associated with a provider control.

Several classes in the Web Parts control set need to determine what connection points are available on a provider control, and when they do they typically call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.GetProviderConnectionPoints%2A> method, which returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection.
This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase> class, making this collection a strongly typed, non-generic, read-only collection.
You cannot add or remove members after an instance has been created.
Initializes an empty new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection"></xref> class.
This constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class with no items in the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection"></xref> class using the specified collection of provider connection points.

This constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class and adds the connection points contained in the `connectionPoints` parameter.

You can use this constructor to create your own collection object of provider connection points, by creating an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> collection of existing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects, and then passing that collection to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29> constructor.

However, you rarely need to create your own collection unless you are extending controls, because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control provides the necessary methods for most common operations involving provider connection points, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.GetProviderConnectionPoints%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> objects used to create the collection.
connectionPoints is `null`.
The collection contains a null connection point.
\- or -
The collection contains an object that is not of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref>.
\- or -
There are duplicate IDs in the collection of connection points.
Returns a value indicating whether a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> object exists in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> to search for.
`true` if the provider connection point is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the collection to an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.CopyTo%2A> method copies all the members of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection to a compatible, one-dimensional array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects, starting at the position in the array that is specified by the `index` parameter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to combine objects from different collections into a single compatible array, and then be able to access the items in the array using array methods.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> objects that receives the copied items of the collection.
The starting point in the array at which to insert the collection contents.
Gets the default connection point from the collection of provider connection points associated with a particular control.

This property provides quick access to the provider connection point that is the default connection point within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection.
The default provider connection point is the primary interface used to establish and maintain a connection with consumers.
Any other provider connection points in the collection provide secondary interfaces to consumers.
The default <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> from a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection"></xref>.
Returns the position of a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> object within a collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.IndexOf%2A> method is useful when there are multiple instances of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects on a page, and your code needs to know the location (or index) of one connection point object relative to the others in the collection.
If the specified provider connection point object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> to locate.
An integer that indicates the zero-based index position of the specified connectionPoint within a .
Gets a member of the collection based on its position in the collection.
The index of a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> at the index specified.
Gets a member of the collection based on a unique string identifier.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> serving as the unique identifier for a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint"></xref> in the collection.
The first whose ID equals the value of id.
